page.title: 01COUNTRYSIDE NORTH OF ASHWELL
page.content: The area is north and west of the village of Ashwell. A few residential houses are included in the block but it is mainly open farmland and farm buildings. The fields are mostly arable although there is pasture for a dairy herd. There are various small roads, many retain their hedges though the elm trees have gone.Recently many new trees have been planted. One road, leading to a derelict bridge, has fallen into disuse. It is a footpath and a county boundary. The river Rhee, a tributary of the Cam, rises just south of the area and forks northwards through the centre of it. There are two large houses, Ashwell End and Elbrook House, as well as old farm houses and cottages which are now not occupied by farming families. A cemetary, a corner of a recreation ground and factory yard are included.
